container-title: 255: there is a large gap in S IV
to 217. After this the text has a small section of the Charrette
note: See Stones 1977. Rouen 1054 (O 5) contains S III and IV and states on the last leaf ‘Explicit Meleagant’, after the formal switch which introduces the Agravain-thread that is the beginning of S V. Yale 229 was perhaps made in Thérouanne or St Omer.
title: 104 R,b): ‘Icy fenist Galehot. Meleagran avoit une seror.’ BN 16998: many leaves are missing from this manuscript. Cambridge, Corpus christi 45: see Hutchings 1934: 189–194. Grenoble 378: Micha states: ‘Contient une partie du tome IV’, but does not indicate where in S IV the ms. begins. New York, Pierpont Morgan 805–6 has a gap (S III, 118–162).
